meanings.definition: To make a cheerful, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The birds chirl happily in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I love to hear the wind chirl through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter seemed to chirl around the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her voice chirls like a melody in the air.
meanings.sent5: The bells chirl joyfully, announcing the celebration.

meanings.sent1: The chirl of the flute filled the room with happiness.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the sweet chirl of the birds outside.
meanings.sent3: The chirl of the kettle signaled that tea time had arrived.
meanings.sent4: The chirl of the laughter echoed in the hallways.
meanings.sent5: The chirl of the wind in the leaves was soothing to the ears.
